Subject: Quickstrike and the thing

If anything had ever embodied the notion of "HUGE" this was it. There
was something that looked like a giant ape, yet was hairless and
leathery. It was very tall, muscular, and chained to the wall. Each
link holding it was at least as big as Quickstrike's arms, and solid
clamps held it to the wall as it was struggling to get to the
intruder. It roared and some drool flew on Quickstrike.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "CatMaster o" <CatMastero@y...> wrote:
> "Well al'righty.  If you arn't a comming out I be comming in after 
> you."  He charged an energy ball in his snake mouth and approached 
> where the roar came from using the light from the energy ball as a 
> lantern.  He slowly approached step by step  taking glances ever way 
> to watch for the creature.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic" <gestaltproject@h...> wrote:
> > There was more of that roar, and a few footsteps, and all the time,
> > there was the ubiquitous sound of a clinking chain. Somehow, the 
> thing
> > would not come out at Quicktrike's demand.
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "CatMaster o" <CatMastero@y...> 
> wrote:
> > > Quickstrike's eyes darted around the room looking for the beast.
> > > "Y-you don't scare me.  Come out and show yourself!"
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic" <gestaltproject@h...> wrote:

> > > primal...

> > > shook 
> > > > > it off.
> > > > > 'Ya can't show weakness or they'll think yer' yellow,'  he 
> > > thought 
> > > > > to himself.  He got into a fighting stance with his snake 
> mouth 
> > > > > opened and ready to fight.
> > > > > "Alright who's the guy who thinks he's toughter then I 
> am!?"  
> > > > > Quickstrike demanded to whoever was listening.
> > > > >

> wrote:

> > > was
> > > > > > > constant, however, there was a loud clicking sound like

> > > > > > > one corner, and also something like a grunting noise...

> > > number.

> > > > > ol'

> his 
> > > way.
